item.title: 达里奥与阿布扎比皇室的 G42 据说将搁置投资合资企业
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，雷-达里奥（Ray Dalio）的家族办公室和谢赫-塔赫农-本-扎耶德-阿勒纳哈扬（Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan）的人工智能公司 G42 已放弃在阿布扎比共同成立一家资产管理企业的计划。【原文：Ray Dalio’s family office and Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan’s artificial intelligence firm G42 have abandoned plans to set up an asset management venture together in Abu Dhabi, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中东冲突爆发，航空公司挤入沙特领空
item.description: 由于中东冲突不断升级，许多航空公司被封锁了飞越伊朗和伊拉克的航线，因此连接欧洲与中东和南亚的航空公司被迫绕道埃及和沙特阿拉伯领空飞行。【原文：Airlines connecting Europe with the Middle East and South Asia are being forced to fly a more circuitous path using Egyptian and Saudi Arabian airspace as the escalating conflict in the Middle East blocks off routes over Iran and Iraq for many carriers.】

item.title: 股市狂热刺激需求，港元供应趋紧
item.description: 由于本地股反弹和季节性因素，港元供应趋紧，使港元兑美元汇率升至允许的最强水平。【原文：The supply of Hong Kong dollars tightened due to a rally in local shares and seasonal factors, nudging the currency toward the strongest level it’s allowed to trade versus the greenback.】

item.title: 肯尼亚第二季度经济增长放缓至 2022 年低点
item.description: 肯尼亚第二季度的经济增长率降至 18 个月以来的最低点，原因是一系列针对高生活成本的抗议活动拖累了产出和消费支出。【原文：Kenya’s economic growth rate fell to the lowest in 18 months in the second quarter as a series of protests over high living costs weighed on output and consumer spending.】

item.title: 日本顶级银行家预测股票将继续上涨，日本央行将利率维持在 1
item.description: 日本最大银行和经纪公司的高层管理人员预测，日本国内股价将进一步上涨，利率也将进一步上调，他们欢迎一位从金融业起家的新首相。【原文：Top executives of Japan’s biggest banks and brokerages predicted further gains in domestic share prices and more interest-rate hikes, as they welcomed a new prime minister who started his career in the financial sector.】

item.title: 中国铁路出行人数创新高，消费前景看好
item.description: 中国铁路网在为期一周的长假首日迎来了创纪录的出行人数，这是世界第二大经济体消费回升的早期迹象。【原文：China’s railway network saw a record number of trips made on the first day of its week-long holiday, offering early signs of a consumer spending pickup in the world’s second-biggest economy.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长金多斯称欧元区经济复苏将得到加强
item.description: 欧洲中央银行副行长路易斯-德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）表示，尽管危险依然存在，但欧元区的经济复苏势头可能会增强。【原文：The economic revival in the euro area is likely to gain momentum, though dangers remain, according to European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos.】

item.title: 以色列誓言对伊朗大规模导弹袭击进行报复
item.description: 伊朗向以色列发射了约 200 枚弹道导弹，本雅明-内塔尼亚胡发誓要对伊朗进行报复。【原文：Benjamin Netanyahu vowed to retaliate against Iran after it fired about 200 ballistic missiles at Israel in a severe escalation of hostilities between the adversaries that world powers fear could spiral into a Middle East-wide war.】

item.title: 肯尼亚议员希望将总统任期延长至七年
item.description: 据《民族日报》刊登的一则公告称，肯尼亚立法者提议修改国家宪法，将总统和议会任期从五年延长至七年。【原文：Kenyan lawmakers proposed revising the nation’s constitution to extend presidential and parliamentary terms to seven years from five, according to a notice published in the Daily Nation newspaper.】

item.title: 泰国交易所新任总裁誓言采取措施恢复投资者信心
item.description: 泰国证券交易所的新任总裁计划优先恢复投资者对泰国资本市场的信心，而投资者的信心因一系列企业丑闻、对非法卖空的担忧以及政治动荡而受到打击。【原文：Thai stock exchange’s new chief plans to prioritize restoring investor confidence in the nation’s capital market that’s been dented by a number of corporate scandals, concerns over illegal short selling and a spell of political turmoil.】

item.title: 南非改革成为吸引投资者的焦点
item.description: 全球最大的投资银行表示，南非需要加快改革步伐，促进经济增长，以维持自联合政府成立以来大量涌入的投资者。【原文：South Africa will need to expedite reforms that can boost economic growth to sustain investor inflows that have flooded in since the formation of a coalition government, according to the world’s largest investment banks.】
